title: Can Yasuo Ult Stop Taking Him Out of Turret Range?
body: It already refreshes his passive and he has a safe dive due to his dash, I don't understand the need for his ult to take him out of turret range.

replies.body: I hate it when I get tower dived, some sort of rune heals them up and at low hp, they somehow tank the turret shot despite not being all that tanky, then another turret shot,  but since they walk away the turret just decides to fucking cancel the finishing blow. I HATE THIS.

His ult is entirely controlled by the game and is a hard self CC. It avoiding tower if the opponent is on the edge of the tower line is necessary for the player to not be randomly screwed by the game and where it wants to place him.

Removing this is impossible without fundamentally changing how his ult works.

His ult always places him behind the target. It's not random.

The only time it changes is when he's under tower.

So this point:

https://leagueoflegends.fandom.com/wiki/Yasuo

He goes outside turret automatically, player input has nothing to do with it nor does his natural ult positioning.

When you knock up multiple targets you select the position you ult at by hovering the champion you want to appear behind relative to your position. You cannot freely select where in your ult AoE you want to go, you always go behind a target.

Read the wiki, play Yasuo, play against Yasuo, use practice tool. All of these are viable options to help you understand this fact.

+ Real swords can only make a few cuts before it must be sharpened again. Even for a trained master, they can't manage more than a few cuts before things like blood, scratches on the edge, cracks on the blade, etc force the user stop and resharpen the blade.
+ Swords cannot generate tornados.
+ A human cannot instantly dash behind an opponent.
+ A human cannot keep a person off the ground for an entire second with just the upward force of a sword slash as the blade is designed to be thin/sharp enough to smoothly separate atoms from atoms with minimal resistance. A slash capable of lifting a person off the ground would require an enormous amount of resistance from the object being slashed to use as an opposing force against the coming force of the blade to then transform the energy from the slash into a physical upward force but at that point it wouldn't be 'cutting', it'd be closer to 'smashing' and that's not what a sword is designed to do. The force of the resistance needed would ultimately snap the blade like a twig and that wouldn't be good for the wielder..

If they remove it automatically doing it, and simply allow us to choose which side he goes (kinda like Kat's E) to that would HELP good Yasuo players, and hurt the already bad ones.

It does this because his R places them behind the opponent. This means he'd end up getting shot **several times** by ulting someone not even in their own fucking turret range without the reposition.

Literally no other champion in the game runs that risk solely on their own kit. Zed *might* if his opponent stuns him immediately after appearing but that's not happening at most tiers because ping alone can render that impossible before he blinks back to safety.

And let me re-emphasize this point, since people keep fucking missing it:

#**YASUO'S R PLACES HIM BEHIND HIS TARGET. THE REPOSITION IS SO THAT HE DOESN'T DIE IF HE FUCKING ULTS SOMEONE OUTSIDE OF THEIR OWN FUCKING TURRET, SINCE HE'D LITERALLY BE THE ONLY CHAMPION WHO THIS CAN HAPPEN TO WITH ONLY THEIR OWN KIT WITHOUT THE REPOSITION**
